releases.summary: Initial release of Core Pro with advanced DevOps foundations beyond the free tier, covering CI/CD, governance, security, reliability, and production decision-making.
highlights: End-to-end failure debugging and recovery across Linux, containers, Kubernetes, CI/CD, and infrastructure
Production-grade CI/CD, GitOps, and automation workflows with rollback, drift, and incident handling
Real-world troubleshooting of resource exhaustion, networking failures, and distributed system breakdowns
Capstone-driven platform recovery scenarios focused on operational ownership and decision-making

releases.summary: Introduced the Observability domain with hands-on labs focused on metrics, logs, alerting, incident command, and decision-making under partial visibility.
highlights: Reasoning under partial and conflicting signals across metrics, logs, traces, and alerts
Incident command, escalation timing, and blast radius containment decisions under pressure
SLO impact assessment and prioritization when alerts conflict with business symptoms
Ownership of irreversible decisions, stakeholder trade-offs, and post-incident accountability

releases.summary: Released the AIOps domain focusing on AI-assisted operations, agent reliability, governance, and human-in-the-loop operational decisions.
highlights: Defining and enforcing human-in-the-loop decision boundaries for AI-assisted operations
Detecting and responding to AI failure modes including confidence drift, silent failures, and automation bias
Governance, auditability, and accountability for AI-driven incident response and change decisions
Ownership of irreversible AI decisions, cumulative risk, and safe decommissioning of AI systems

releases.summary: Launched CloudOps (AWS) domain covering real-world AWS architecture failures, resilience design, IAM issues, and operational decision-making.
highlights: Architectural decision-making across regions, availability zones, and shared AWS services under failure conditions
Blast radius analysis of IAM, networking, and public exposure misconfigurations
Incident response to large-scale AWS failures including traffic collapse, retry storms, and control-plane vs data-plane outages
Cross-team and cross-signal incident coordination with platform-level ownership and governance trade-offs

releases.summary: Launched CloudOps (Azure) domain focusing on Azure infrastructure failures, identity design, networking, and operational trade-offs.
highlights: Reasoning about subscription, management group, and resource scope boundaries in complex Azure environments
Control-plane behavior, propagation delays, and enforcement gaps across RBAC, policy, and networking
Identity, quota, and configuration drift incidents driven by eventual consistency and state desynchronization
Long-horizon governance failures involving ownership fragmentation, landing zone authority, and cost pressure

releases.summary: Launched CloudOps (GCP) domain covering Google Cloud architecture failures, reliability design, IAM models, and production operations.
highlights: Reasoning under limited visibility across projects, services, and control-plane vs data-plane boundaries
Failure analysis driven by shared dependencies, hidden coupling, and cross-project blast radius
IAM, service account, and workload identity risk involving privilege propagation and latent access accumulation
Long-horizon operational risk from quota dynamics, governance drift, and fragmented operating models
